intro: Ceropegia stayneri, commonly known as the string of hearts plant, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or white, which are pollinated by specific insect species. It thrives in well-draining soil and requires bright, indirect light to flourish. Due to its ornamental value, it is widely cultivated as a houseplant.
